intro: Psidium gentlei, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or gentle guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil and is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are similar in appearance to guavas but have a distinct, sweet aroma.
